original: @94a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @94a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'aryo gra t'a ra s'a dh'a nam n'a ma /
analyzed: a'aryo gra t'a ra s'a dh'a nam n'a ma /
translated: Aryatārāsādhana-nāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags ma sgrol ma drag mo'i sgrub thabs zhes bya ba /
analyzed: 'phags ma sgrol ma drag mo'i sgrub thabs zhes bya ba /
translated: The Means of Achievement Called The Wrathful Tārā

original: bcom ldan 'das ma ral gcig ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma ral gcig ma la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, Ekajaṭī.

original: h'um yig las byung g-yon ba rkyang zhabs ni ro yi snying ga la gtad cing /
analyzed: h'um yig las byung g-yon ba rkyang zhabs ni ro yi snying ga la gtad cing /
translated: From the syllable hūṃ, the left foot of the corpse is placed on the heart,

original: mchog tu drag tu bzhad pa'i phyag gis ral gri autpala gri gug bsnams //
analyzed: mchog tu drag tu bzhad pa'i phyag gis ral gri autpala gri gug bsnams //
translated: and with a hand laughing with the most intense wrath, she holds a sword, lotus, and flaying knife.

original: nag mo sbom thung cher yangs dmar ser ral ba'i lan tshar drag po yi //
analyzed: nag mo sbom thung cher yangs dmar ser ral ba'i lan tshar drag po yi //
translated: Dark, stout, short, very wide, with reddish-brown dreadlocks,

original: klus rgyan ka p'a lar bkod 'jig rten gsum rmongs bdag la bzhon par mdzod //
analyzed: klus rgyan ka p'a lar bkod 'jig rten gsum rmongs bdag la bzhon par mdzod //
translated: adorned with snakes, placed in a skull cup, bewildering the three worlds, ride for me.

original: srid gsum sgrol mdzad rgya nag rim pa'i sgrol ma la btud de //
analyzed: srid gsum sgrol mdzad rgya nag rim pa'i sgrol ma la btud de //
translated: Having bowed to Tārā of the Chinese tradition, who liberates the three worlds,

original: bla ma'i man ngag ji bzhin de yi sgrub thabs cho ga brjod //
analyzed: bla ma'i man ngag ji bzhin de yi sgrub thabs cho ga brjod //
translated: I will explain the ritual of her means of achievement, just as the guru taught.

original: ling ga gcig pa'am dur khrod rtag tu stong ba'i khang ba yi //
analyzed: ling ga gcig pa'am dur khrod rtag tu stong ba'i khang ba yi //
translated: In a charnel ground, or always in an empty house,

original: gnas dir srid gsum las grol rig ma rnal 'byor ba yis sgrub //
analyzed: gnas dir srid gsum las grol rig ma rnal 'byor ba yis sgrub //
translated: The yogi who is liberated from the three worlds should practice with a consort in this place.

original: byis pa'i ro ni 'jam po'i stan nam gzhan yang 'jam ba yis //
analyzed: byis pa'i ro ni 'jam po'i stan nam gzhan yang 'jam ba yis //
translated: Having sat on a soft seat, a child’s corpse, or another soft thing,

original: stan la yang dag 'dug ste dngos grub mchog ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: stan la yang dag 'dug ste dngos grub mchog ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: one should accomplish the supreme attainment.

original: skad cig rnam pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje gsum po gnas gsum du //
analyzed: skad cig rnam pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje gsum po gnas gsum du //
translated: By the application of the instant [recollection], the three vajras in the three places

original: mnyam par gzhag pas bsam byas de las 'od zer rab 'phros pas //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pas bsam byas de las 'od zer rab 'phros pas //
translated: are visualized by the one who is equipoised, and from them light radiates

original: srid gsum spyod pa'i sems can rnams ni yang @94b yang gsal byas nas //
analyzed: srid gsum spyod pa'i sems can rnams ni yang @94b yang gsal byas nas //
translated: and illuminates again and again the sentient beings who are the three worlds.

original: sna tshogs slar yang bsdus te kun nas stong pa nyid du bsam //
analyzed: sna tshogs slar yang bsdus te kun nas stong pa nyid du bsam //
translated: The various [beings] are gathered back in and visualized as completely empty.

original: de nas sh'un+ya t'a sogs rang bzhin rgyal ba'i gsang sngags brjod //
analyzed: de nas sh'un+ya t'a sogs rang bzhin rgyal ba'i gsang sngags brjod //
translated: Then one should recite the secret mantra of the Victors, the nature of which is the śūnyatā [mantra].

original: de nas nam mkha' a'a:yig las byung chu skyes dmar po bsam //
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' a'a:yig las byung chu skyes dmar po bsam //
translated: Then in the sky one should visualize an āḥ syllable, from which arises a red lotus.

original: slar yang de steng t'am yig las ni padma'i snod bsam bya //
analyzed: slar yang de steng t'am yig las ni padma'i snod bsam bya //
translated: Again, on top of that, one should visualize a tāṃ syllable, from which arises a lotus vessel.

original: de yi dbus su h'um yig mthon mthing dang mtshungs bsam byas nas //
analyzed: de yi dbus su h'um yig mthon mthing dang mtshungs bsam byas nas //
translated: In the middle of that one should visualize a hūṃ syllable, which is the color of dark blue.

original: h'um yig de las byung ba'i gri gug sa bon gyis brgyan blta //🔽gri gug yongs gyur bdag nyid sgrol ma dang mtshungs bsam bya ste //
analyzed: h'um yig de las byung ba'i gri gug sa bon gyis brgyan blta // gri gug yongs gyur bdag nyid sgrol ma dang mtshungs bsam bya ste //
translated: From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.

original: g-yon brkyang zhabs can mi bzad mgo bo'i phreng bas rab tu brgyan //🔽sbom thung 'jigs ma gsus pa 'phyang zhing chu skyes sngon pos mdzes //
analyzed: g-yon brkyang zhabs can mi bzad mgo bo'i phreng bas rab tu brgyan // sbom thung 'jigs ma gsus pa 'phyang zhing chu skyes sngon pos mdzes //
translated: From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.

original: zhal gcig spyan gsum drag tu bzhad pa'i bzang mo 'od bzang can //🔽rab tu dgyes pas ro mnan klu brgyad kyis ni rnam brgyan ma //
analyzed: zhal gcig spyan gsum drag tu bzhad pa'i bzang mo 'od bzang can // rab tu dgyes pas ro mnan klu brgyad kyis ni rnam brgyan ma //
translated: From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.

original: dmar zhing zlum pa'i spyan can stag gi pags pas smad dkris la //🔽phyag rgya lnga yis rab brgyan lang tsho gsar ba phun tshogs ldan //🔽bskyod pa'i ljags dang mche ba gtsigs pas 'jigs byed phyag bzhi yi //
analyzed: dmar zhing zlum pa'i spyan can stag gi pags pas smad dkris la // phyag rgya lnga yis rab brgyan lang tsho gsar ba phun tshogs ldan // bskyod pa'i ljags dang mche ba gtsigs pas 'jigs byed phyag bzhi yi //
translated: From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.

original: g-yas pas ral gri gri gug g-yon na autpala thod pa bsnams //
analyzed: g-yas pas ral gri gri gug g-yon na autpala thod pa bsnams //
translated: From that arises a flaying knife marked with the seed syllable.🔽From that arises a f

original: dmar ser gyen brdzes ral gcig cod pan mi bskyod brgyan //
analyzed: dmar ser gyen brdzes ral gcig cod pan mi bskyod brgyan //
translated: The single-braided crown is orange, upraised, and adorned with Akṣobhya.

original: bsgom pa'i stobs ni rdzogs las rnal 'byor snyan dngags chen por 'gyur //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i stobs ni rdzogs las rnal 'byor snyan dngags chen por 'gyur //
translated: The power of meditation is the great yoga of poetry.

original: gal te rmongs shing blun pa'ang bsgom pa'i ro la 'bad byed na //
analyzed: gal te rmongs shing blun pa'ang bsgom pa'i ro la 'bad byed na //
translated: If one who is deluded and foolish strives for the taste of meditation,

original: sngags bzlas 'bum phrag gcig gis 'jam pa'i tshig nyid thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sngags bzlas 'bum phrag gcig gis 'jam pa'i tshig nyid thob par 'gyur //
translated: by reciting the mantra one hundred thousand times, one will attain gentle speech.

original: snying gar yig gsum sngags chen 'di bkod phad yig mtha' ru'o //
analyzed: snying gar yig gsum sngags chen 'di bkod phad yig mtha' ru'o //
translated: The three syllables of the great mantra are placed at the heart, with the anusvāra at the end.

original: 'od zer lnga dang ldan pas mi shes bud shing bsreg byed pa //
analyzed: 'od zer lnga dang ldan pas mi shes bud shing bsreg byed pa //
translated: Endowed with five light rays, it burns the firewood of ignorance.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i rjes 'brang de nyid btu ba'i cho ga brjod //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i rjes 'brang de nyid btu ba'i cho ga brjod //
translated: The procedure for extracting reality is stated in the commentary on the yoga practice.

original: dang por sa yi pha rol bzhi pa'i dbyangs nyid byin pas brgyan //
analyzed: dang por sa yi pha rol bzhi pa'i dbyangs nyid byin pas brgyan //
translated: First, the fourth vowel, ā, is adorned with the fourth consonant, pha.

original: ra yig la zhon 'od 'phro zla ba thig ler yang dag ldan //
analyzed: ra yig la zhon 'od 'phro zla ba thig ler yang dag ldan //
translated: Mounted on the syllable ra, it radiates light, endowed with the drop of the moon.

original: de nas bzhi pa steng du byin pas brgyan pa'i t'am yig dang // ring po'i au dang sbyor ba'i slar yang ham yig dang ldan pa //
analyzed: de nas bzhi pa steng du byin pas brgyan pa'i t'am yig dang // ring po'i au dang sbyor ba'i slar yang ham yig dang ldan pa //
translated: Then, the fourth, the syllable Taṃ, adorned with the gift above, and again endowed with the syllable Haṃ, joined with the long U.

original: de nas phad yig byin pas yongs su rdzogs pa'i sngags grub bo //🔽ral gri mi rus phreng ba'i gnas @95a * //
analyzed: de nas phad yig byin pas yongs su rdzogs pa'i sngags grub bo // ral gri mi rus phreng ba'i gnas @95a * //
translated: Then, the syllable Phaṃ, the mantra is perfected with the gift.

original: su mkhas pas bsam bya ste //
analyzed: su mkhas pas bsam bya ste //
translated: The wise one should imagine the skull in the place of the sword and the rosary of human bone.

original: spro dang bsdu ba'i sbyor ba yis ni yang dag bsngags mchog bzlas //
analyzed: spro dang bsdu ba'i sbyor ba yis ni yang dag bsngags mchog bzlas //
translated: Recite the supreme mantra with the application of emanating and gathering.

original: brtan pa'i sems kyis rang nyid mkhas dang snyan dngags chen por brtag / rtag tu bsgom pa goms las the tshom med par 'gyur ba nyid //
analyzed: brtan pa'i sems kyis rang nyid mkhas dang snyan dngags chen por brtag / rtag tu bsgom pa goms las the tshom med par 'gyur ba nyid //
translated: With a steadfast mind, one should imagine oneself as a wise one and a great poet. Through constant familiarization with meditation, one will undoubtedly become so.

original: sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs bdag gis byas las dge ba gang bsags pa //
analyzed: sgrol ma'i sgrub thabs bdag gis byas las dge ba gang bsags pa //
translated: Whatever virtue I have accumulated by composing this practice of Tārā,

original: de yis srog chags rnams ni rgyal ba'i bstan la mkhas gyur cig /'di ni rtag pa'i rdo rje'i zhabs kis mdzad pa dag ste 'dir //
analyzed: de yis srog chags rnams ni rgyal ba'i bstan la mkhas gyur cig /'di ni rtag pa'i rdo rje'i zhabs kis mdzad pa dag ste 'dir //
translated: by that, may all beings become wise in the teachings of the Victor. This was composed by the one with the name of Ratnamati.

original: nags gang mchog gi skye bo rnams kyis bzod par mdzad pa'i rigs ral pa gcig ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: nags gang mchog gi skye bo rnams kyis bzod par mdzad pa'i rigs ral pa gcig ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of Ekajaṭī, the one who is worthy of being endured by the supreme beings of the forest, is complete.

original: // / rgya gar shar phyogs kyi panti ta chen po nags kyi rin chen gyi zhal snga nas /
analyzed: // / rgya gar shar phyogs kyi panti ta chen po nags kyi rin chen gyi zhal snga nas /
translated: By the great eastern Indian paṇḍita Vanaratna.

original: dge slong chos smra ba bsod nams rgya mtsho'i sdes bsgyur ba'o /
analyzed: dge slong chos smra ba bsod nams rgya mtsho'i sdes bsgyur ba'o /
translated: Translated by the monk and dharma preacher Sönam Gyatso.

original: // / aom hr'i: ae ka dz'a t'im mo sa n'i t'a ya sarba satv'a n'am sh'antam ku ru pushtim ku ru raksham ku ru ma h'a taksha ka n'a g'a dhi pa ti ye ai mam ba lim grihna grihna grihn'a pa ya grihn'a pa ya pa ra bi dy'a karsha
analyzed: // / aom hr'i: ae ka dz'a t'im mo sa n'i t'a ya sarba satv'a n'am sh'antam ku ru pushtim ku ru raksham ku ru ma h'a taksha ka n'a g'a dhi pa ti ye ai mam ba lim grihna grihna grihn'a pa ya grihn'a pa ya pa ra bi dy'a karsha
translated: Oṃ hrīḥ ekajaṭīṃ mocaya tāya sarvasattvānāṃ śāntikaṃ kuru puṣṭikaṃ kuru rakṣaṃ kuru mahātakṣaka nāgādhipate imaṃ baliṃ gṛhṇa gṛhṇa gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya paravidyākarṣa

original: y'a karsha ta ta tra ta tstshe da tstshe da /
analyzed: y'a karsha ta ta tra ta tstshe da tstshe da /
translated: yākarṣa taṃ taṃ taca taca

original: tstshe da ya tstshe da ya aom a'a:h'um phad sv'ah'a /
analyzed: tstshe da ya tstshe da ya aom a'a:h'um phad sv'ah'a /
translated: ceda ceda oṃ āḥ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: gtor ma'i sngags so//
analyzed: gtor ma'i sngags so//
translated: The bali mantra.
